FuncDef:
The acl dhcp-discover disable command disables DHCP-DISCOVER packets from matching against ACLs in the blacklist, whitelist, or user-defined flow.
The undo acl dhcp-discover disablecommand enables DHCP-DISCOVER packets to match against ACLs in the blacklist, whitelist, or user-defined flow.
By default, DHCP-DISCOVER packets are enabled from matching against ACLs in the blacklist, whitelist, or user-defined flow.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, DHCP-DISCOVER packets are matched against ACL rules in the whitelist, blacklist, and user-defined flow when being sent to the CPU. To disable IPv4 MFIB-MISS packets to match against ACLs in the blacklist, whitelist, or user-defined flow, run the acl dhcp-discover disable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
